info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued October 24 at 7:40PM CDT until October 24 at 8:30PM CDT by NWS San Angelo TX
info.description:
At 739 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms with light to moderate rain across the warned area. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.25 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly.
HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms.
SOURCE...Radar.
IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas.
Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... San Angelo, O.C. Fisher Reservoir, San Angelo State Park, Grape Creek, Carlsbad, Lake Nasworthy, Goodfellow Air Force Base, Twin Buttes Reservoir, Tankersley, Orient, Water Valley, Wall, Veribest, Harriet and Us-67 Near The Irion-Tom Green County Line.
People attending San Angelo Stadium, Water Valley Wildcat Field, and Wall Hawk Stadium should seek shelter immediately.
This includes the following Low Water Crossings... College Hills and Millbrook, Howard and Webster, Jackson From Knickerbocker to South Bryant, Southwest Blvd and Loop 306, FM 2334 crossing Dry Lipan Creek, Sul Ross At Red Arroyo Crossing, Huntington and Sunset, FM 2334 crossing Ninemile Creek, FM 1692 crossing Sales Branch and Huntington and Sunset.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR NORTHEASTERN TOM GREEN COUNTY
